results.title: Film and reality
results.creator_credit: Ernest Lindgren, Alberto Cavalcanti and BFI
results.brief_description: A compilation documentary which follows the history of Realist film from the earliest days until World War II. The film is presented in five sections - early Realist film and its divorce from film drama; foundations of the Realist film; romantic documentary on “Far-Off Lands”; the Realistic Documentary of “Life at home”; Realism and the Story Film - the Feature Film. Some of the films on display are: Nanook of the North, Rien que les heures, The General Line, Drifters etc.

results.title: Filling time
results.creator_credit: Andy Walker, Colin Thomas, BBC and Aardman Animations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Conversations”.
Another in the series of films whose starting point is the sound track, made by pinning a radio microphone to the central character. The resulting ‘natural conversation’ was edited down to five minutes and the animator allowed free visual interpretation. This one is about a visit to the dentist.

results.title: Filing procedures in business
results.brief_description: Shows a large efficient central filing system functioning as an integral part of a well-run business organisation. The film is designed to teach students the correct procedures to be followed in operating such a filing system.

results.title: Filez, filez, o mon navire. J'ai tant danse.
results.creator_credit: Jim MacKay, George Dunning and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Chants populaires”.
Animated interpretation of two French folk songs. Featuring the Quatuor Alouette and L’Assistance. ‘Filez, filez, o mon naivre’ 3.42 mins. ‘J’ai tant danse’ 2.20 mins.

results.title: Files and filing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”.
The correct method of use and the difficulties to be overcome in order to fall into the way of making straight, level strokes when filing, whether it be heavy, light or ordinary filing. Different kinds of files are demonstrated including methods of cleaning files, and finally, the importace of practice by the student or trainee is stressed.

results.title: Filbert and the melon cheater: subtraction with borrowing
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Introduces two digit subtraction problems, including those which require regrouping, through an animated story about the problems of an honest melon merchant. Filbert devises an accounting system called “dump a box” based on subtraction with borrowing to try to stop a melon thief. Suitable for upper primary level.
results.title_for_label: Filbert and the melon cheater: subtraction with borrowing

results.title: Fiji - legacies of empire
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Dennis O'Rourke, Cinema Enterprises and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human face of the Pacific”.
This series looks at the Pacific islands, the traditions associated with them and issues that pose problems to them. This particular film examines the different aspects of life in Fiji. It notes the opinions of a patriarch of the hard-working Indian population and explores the co-existence of Hindus and Moslems who own less than a fifth of the land. Camera by Dennis O’Rourke and Joe Pickering.

results.title: Fiji
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Oceans of Dreams - Currents of Change Series”.
The film examines contemporary Fiji since it became a Republic in 1987 when the ruling power of the indigenous Fijians was consolidated.
